Package: com.github.jrubygradle

[Groovy] Class JRubyPluginExtension

    • com.github.jrubygradle.JRubyPluginExtension

    • Class providing the jruby{} DSL extension to the Gradle build script

      • Properties Summary

          Properties 
          Type Name and description
          static java.lang.String  DEFAULT_JRUBY_VERSION
          boolean  defaultRepositories
          Set this to false if you do not want the default set of repositories to be loaded.
          java.lang.String  defaultVersion
          The default version of jruby that will be used
          java.lang.String  execVersion
          The version of jruby used by jrubyexec as well as default version of jruby that will be used by JRubyExec

      • Constructor Summary

          Constructors 
          Constructor and description
          JRubyPluginExtension (org.gradle.api.Project p)

          Set the default version of JRuby to be used by all JRuby/Gradle code

          Resolves the currently configured Jars installation directory.

      • Property Detail

        • static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_JRUBY_VERSION

        • @org.gradle.api.Incubating boolean defaultRepositories

          Set this to false if you do not want the default set of repositories to be loaded.

          Since:
          0.1.1

        • java.lang.String defaultVersion

          The default version of jruby that will be used

        • @java.lang.Deprecated java.lang.String execVersion

          The version of jruby used by jrubyexec as well as default version of jruby that will be used by JRubyExec

          deprecated:
          Setting execVersion is not very often done and should probably be avoided. Set jrubyVersion on your JRubyExec tasks instead

      • Constructor Detail

        • JRubyPluginExtension(org.gradle.api.Project p)

      • Method Detail

        • void defaultVersion(java.lang.String newDefaultVersion)

          Set the default version of JRuby to be used by all JRuby/Gradle code

          Parameters:
          newDefaultVersion
          Since:
          1.1.0

        • java.io.File getGemInstallDir()

          Resolves the currently configured GEM installation directory.

          Returns:
          Install directory as an absolute path
          Since:
          0.1.12

        • @java.lang.Deprecated java.io.File getJarInstallDir()

          Resolves the currently configured Jars installation directory.

          Returns:
          Install directory as an absolute path
          Since:
          0.1.16

        • @org.gradle.api.Incubating void registerDefaultVersionCallback(groovy.lang.Closure callback)

          Register a callback to be invoked when defaultVersion is updated NOTE: This is primarily meant for JRuby/Gradle plugin developers

          Parameters:
          callback
          Since:
          1.1.0

        • @org.gradle.api.Incubating void registerExecVersionCallback(groovy.lang.Closure callback)

          Register a callback to be invoked when execVersion is updated This is primarily meant for JRuby/Gradle plugin developers. You can expect that this callback will be executed if defaultVersion is changed but execVersion is not changed.

          Parameters:
          callback
          Since:
          1.1.0

        • void setDefaultVersion(java.lang.String newDefaultVersion)

        • @java.lang.Deprecated void setExecVersion(java.lang.String newVersion)

          Change the version of jruby for jrubyexec and JRubyExec

          deprecated:
          Setting execVersion is not very often done and should probably be avoided. Set jrubyVersion on your JRubyExec tasks instead
          Parameters:
          newVersion

        • @java.lang.Deprecated java.lang.Object setGemInstallDir(java.lang.Object dir)

          Sets the gem installation directory. Anything that can be passed to project.file can be passed here as well.

          deprecated:
          Setting a custom gemInstallDir can cause dependencies to overlap and unexpected behavior. Please use Configurations instead
          Returns:
          The passed object.
          Parameters:
          dir - Directory (String, GString, File, Closure etc.)
          Since:
          0.1.12

        • @java.lang.Deprecated java.lang.Object setJarInstallDir(java.lang.Object dir)

          Sets the jar installation directory. Anything that can be passed to project.file can be passed here as well.

          deprecated:
          Setting a custom jarInstallDir can cause dependencies to overlap and unexpected behavior. Please use Configurations instead
          Returns:
          The passed object.
          Parameters:
          dir - Directory (String, GString, File, Closure etc.)
          Since:
          0.1.16
